page.title: 15PLAYGROUND GAMES
page.content: Polo needs three or more players. One person is chosen to think of a subject such as "birds". The others think of things connected with the subject such as "robins". The person who was chosen then chooses one answer and calls out that word. The person chosen runs and so does whoever thought of the answer. They run up and down three times. Whoever wins chooses the next subject. Chain-tig needs about ten people. Two people are chosen and the others run. The two that were chosen have to hold hands and tap one of the others. When one is tapped he has to hold hands with the other two. When they tap another person they separate into twos. The pairs carry on tapping people. When all the people have been tapped they start the game again.
